snippet: Syrian opposition groups put aside their grievances to form one body as a prerequisite for new talks with President Bashar al-Assad of Syria and rebels and government forces agreed to a truce in Homs.
abstract: Contentious Syrian rebel groups form fragile alliance for conducting peace talks with Syrian government, fulfilling precondition prescribed by United States; diplomats hope development, coming on heels of local truce in Syrian city of Homs, can quell chaos which has benefited jihadist forces like Islamic State.

byline.contributor: Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: Syrian opposition groups put aside their grievances to form one body as a prerequisite for new talks with President Bashar al-Assad of Syria and rebels and government forces agreed to a truce in Homs.

headline.main: Syrian Rebels Form Bloc for New Round of Peace Talks
headline.print_headline: Syrian Rebels Form Bloc for New Round of Peace Talks

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
